member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.BeginEvent
member.summary: For internal use only. Not intended to be called directly.
member.param: Internal.
Internal.
Internal.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.BeginQuery
member.param: A pointer to an specifying the storage for this query.
A member of the enumeration specifying the type of the query.
The index of the query within the query heap.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.ClearState
member.summary: Resets the state of a direct command list back to the state it was in when the command list was created.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.Close
member.summary: Indicates that recording to the command list has finished.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, returns one of the following values:

item.description: E_FAIL if the command list has already been closed, or an invalid API was called during command list recording.
E_OUTOFMEMORY if the operating system ran out of memory during recording.
E_INVALIDARG if an invalid argument was passed to the command list API during recording.

returns.para: See Direct3D 12 Return Codes for other possible return values.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.DecodeFrame
member.summary: Records a decode frame operation to the command list. Inputs, outputs, and parameters for the decode are specified as arguments to this method.
member.param: A pointer to an interface representing a decoder instance.
A structure specifying the output surface and output arguments.
A structure specifying the input bitstream, reference frames, and other input parameters.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.DiscardResource
member.summary: Indicate that the current contents of a resource can be discarded. The current contents of the resource are no longer valid allowing optimizations for subsequent operations such as .
member.param: A pointer to the interface for the resource to discard.
A pointer to a structure that describes details for the discard-resource operation.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.EndEvent
member.summary: For internal use only. Not intended to be called directly.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.EndQuery
member.param: A pointer to an specifying the storage for this query.
A member of the enumeration specifying the type of the query.
The index of the query within the query heap.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.Reset
member.summary: Resets a command list back to its initial state as if a new command list was just created.
member.param: A pointer to the object that the device creates command lists from.
member.returns:
Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, returns one of the following values:
E_FAIL if the command list was not in the "closed" state when the Reset call was made, or the per-device limit would have been exceeded.
E_OUTOFMEMORY if the operating system ran out of memory.
E_INVALIDARG if the allocator is currently being used with another command list in the "recording" state or if the specified allocator was created with the wrong type.
See Direct3D 12 Return Codes for other possible return values.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.ResolveQueryData
member.param: A pointer to an specifying the storage containing the queries to resolve.
A member of the enumeration specifying the type of the query.
The index of the first query to resolve.
The number of queries to resolve.
A pointer to an representing the destination buffer. The resource must be in the state .
The alignment offset into the destination buffer. This must be a multiple of 8 bytes.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.ResourceBarrier
member.summary: Notifies the driver that it needs to synchronize multiple accesses to resources.
member.param: The number of submitted barrier descriptions.
Pointer to an array of barrier descriptions.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.SetMarker
member.summary: For internal use only. Not intended to be called directly.
member.param: Internal.
Internal.
Internal.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.SetPredication
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent commands should not be performed if the predicate value passes the specified operation.
member.param: A pointer to an representing the buffer from which to read the 64-bit predication value.
The UINT64-aligned buffer offset.
A member of the enumeration specifying the predicate operation.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList.WriteBufferImmediate
member.summary: Writes a number of 32-bit immediate values to the specified buffer locations directly from the command stream.
member.param: The number of elements in the pParams and pModes arrays.
The address of an array of structures of size Count.
The address of an array of structures of size Count. The default value is null. Passing null causes the system to write all immediate values using D3D12_WRITEBUFFERIMMEDIATE_MODE_DEFAULT.

member.name: ID3D12VideoDecodeCommandList
member.summary: Encapsulates a list of graphics commands for video decoding. This interface is inherited by .
